com.orc.io
Class SimpleClientMultiplexer

java.lang.Object
  com.orc.io.SimpleClientMultiplexer

public class SimpleClientMultiplexer
extends java.lang.Object

This is a simple multiplexer set up to assume the duties of a client connecting to a server. As such it will deal with onConnect, onRead and onWrite but not onAccept

See Also:
for a Server based multiplexer

Constructor Summary
SimpleClientMultiplexer(MultiplexListener client, java.lang.String target, int port)
          Pass in the neccessary info
 
Method Summary
 void connect()
          The simple client will attempt to connect and register callbacks in the constructor In a more robust model you would want to be able to control this, but for this I'm favoring simplicity
 void run()
          This is the heart of the multiplexor.

Parameters:
client - The MultiplexListener that the Selector will call back when events occur

Throws:
java.io.IOException
Method Detail

connect

public void connect()
             throws java.io.IOException
The simple client will attempt to connect and register callbacks in the constructor In a more robust model you would want to be able to control this, but for this I'm favoring simplicity

Throws:
java.io.IOException

run

public void run()
This is the heart of the multiplexor. When the program enters this method it will block until an event occurs on the socket at which point the MultiplexListener will be called back. In this case a connect will be called when the client establishes a connection with the server. Read will be called when the server writes data to the client Write will be called when the client is able to write to the server
